page.title: 06The Obelisk
page.content: The Obelisk is a monument in memory of a young gentleman called Gregory Wales.Mr Wales died in 1739, and was buried in the parish of Little Shelford.The Obelisk was erected by Mr Wales friend James Church ESC.Mr Wales was the Justice of the peace, the county deputy and the county treasurer conservator of the land.The Obelisk was erected in a field between Little Shelford and Hauxton.The Obelisk has a pyramid base with a flat top,on top is a box like structure with slabs of stone on the side of the box with writing on about Gregory Wales.Above the box is a pillar of stone about four meters high.On top of the stone pillar there is a flame in the shape of an acorn.
